StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genetics of Chronic Recurrent Multifocal Osteomyelitis

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This data was generated through funding from the National Institute of Arthritis, Musculoskeletal and Skin Disease (NIAMS) from the National Institutes of Health (NIH), Bethesda, MD and the University of Iowa Carver College of Medicine, Iowa City, IA. Drs. Ronald Laxer, Hospital for Sick Children, University of Toronto, Toronto, Ontario and Dr. Yongdong (Dan) Zhao, Seattle Children’s/University of Washington, Seattle, WA made significant contributions to the project by enrolling their cohort of CRMO patients. Many in the international pediatric rheumatology community referred individuals with CRMO and their families to our studies. Most importantly, the patients and their families that contributed are to be thanked for participating in this research.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Autoinflammatory Disease, IRB, PUB, NPU, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-AINFD-IRB-PUB-NPU-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Autoinflammatory Disease and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
Other related disorders include: Inflammatory bowel disease, celiac, inflammatory arthritis, inflammatory dermatosis, vasculitis, uveitis, dyserythropoietic anemia, other diseases in the literature reported to co-occur with CRMO, SAPHO.
